description: The EVN segment is used to communicate necessary trigger event information to receiving applications. Valid event types for all chapters are contained in HL7 Table 0003 - Event type.

fields.name: Event Type Code
fields.description: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only.  We recommend using the second component (trigger event) of MSH-9 - Message Type to transmit event type code information. This field contains the events corresponding to the trigger events described in this section, e.g., admission, transfer, or registration. Refer to HL7 Table 0003 - Event type for valid values.

fields.name: Recorded Date/Time
fields.description: Most systems will default to the system date/time when the transaction was entered, but they should also permit an override.

fields.name: Date/Time Planned Event
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the event is planned. We recommend that PV2-8 - Expected Admit Date/Time, PV2-9 - Expected Discharge Date/Time or PV2-47 - Expected LOA Return date/time be used whenever possible.

fields.name: Event Reason Code
fields.description: This field contains the reason for this event. Refer to User-defined Table 0062 - Event reason for suggested values.

fields.name: Operator ID
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field identifies the individual responsible for triggering the event. Refer to User-defined Table 0188 - Operator ID for suggested values.

fields.name: Event Occurred
fields.description: This field contains the date/time that the event actually occurred. For example, on a transfer (A02 transfer a patient), this field would contain the date/time the patient was actually transferred. On a cancellation event, this field should contain the date/time that the event being cancelled occurred.

fields.name: Event Facility
fields.description: This field identifies the actual facility where the event occured as differentiated from the sending facility (MSH-4). It would be the facility at which the Operator (EVN-5) has entered the event.
